references.paper_title: Zero-1-to-3: Zero-shot one image to 3d object
references.reason: This paper introduces Zero-1-to-3, a foundational model for single-object novel view synthesis that this work builds upon and extends to multi-object scenarios.
This work introduces denoising diffusion probabilistic models, the core generative model used in this research.

references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models.
references.reason: This paper presents Stable Diffusion, the specific diffusion model architecture employed and adapted in this study.
This paper introduces the Segment Anything Model (SAM), used for object segmentation which is key to incorporating structural information in the proposed MOVIS model.

references.paper_title: ZeroNVS: Zero-shot 360-degree view synthesis from a single real image
references.reason: ZeroNVS is a crucial baseline and inspiration for this work, demonstrating the application of diffusion models for scene-level novel view synthesis, motivating the focus on cross-view consistency in multi-object scenarios.
